item.title: Shortcut/Symlink
item.author: Shoaib Bakhtyar
item.description: Suppose we have the following directory that we would like to create a shortcutto. We can use the bash command ln to create a shortcut or symlink (as its called in Linux). our dir —> /run/user/310617548/gvfs/smb-share:server=10.1.111.10,share=forskning03$/Dioxinlab/mzML-files/ We can use the following command to create a shortcut/symlink to this directory at the current location (from where the command is executed). The shortcut name will be files_to_move. 1 sudo ln -s '/run/user/310617548/gvfs/smb-share:server=10.1.111.10,share=forskning03$/Dioxinlab/_mzML-files/' files_to_move
